title: ​7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations - Times Now
summary:
7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024, Source: Times Now Digital

Working along the lines of Atmanirbhar Bharat, India is witnessing the growth of electric mobility with the introduction to electric vehicles, and less dependence on fuel. Here are 7 Indian states/UTs with the highest EV public charging stations, contributing to its growth.

  • Karnataka: 5,765 EV charging stations
  • Maharashtra: 3,728 EV charging stations
  • Delhi: 1,941 EV charging stations
  • Uttar Pradesh: 1,989 EV charging stations
  • Tamil Nadu: 1,413 EV charging stations
  • Kerala: 1,212 EV charging stations
  • Rajasthan: 1,129 EV charging stations
“Karnataka has set the benchmark with 5,765 public EV stations in India, recording the highest number of charging stations in the country.”

This boost in EV infrastructure is pivotal for India's move towards sustainable transportation and reduced carbon emissions.
newTitle: 7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations

title: More Pain Likely, Market Expert Says After Bitcoin's Biggest Loss Since August - CoinDesk
summary:
More Pain Likely, Market Expert Says After Bitcoin's Biggest Loss Since August

Date: Dec 23, 2024

Source: CoinDesk

Bitcoin's recent 8% price drop has led market expert Andre Dragosch to caution investors about potential further losses, suggesting it may present a 'buy the dip' opportunity.

  • The recent decline saw Bitcoin fall nearly 8.8% to around $95,000.
  • The Federal Reserve's stance on future rate cuts has contributed to negative sentiment in the markets.
  • The increase in Treasury yields and a stronger dollar further impacts cryptocurrencies negatively.
  • Dragosch previously predicted a significant BTC rally despite market skepticism.
  • He notes the ongoing BTC supply deficit could present a buying opportunity amidst the downturn.
The Fed is scared of this scenario which is why Powell will probably do too little/too late… Expect more pain over the coming weeks. — André Dragosch

In summary, while short-term pain seems likely, there may be long-term benefits for investors capitalizing on Bitcoin's supply constraints.

title: India Cements soars 11% as UltraTech Cement’s stake buyout gets CCI nod - Upstox
summary:
India Cements soars 11% as UltraTech Cement’s stake buyout gets CCI nod

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: The Economic Times

Shares of India Cements surged 11% in early trade on Monday after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) approved UltraTech Cement Ltd’s controlling stake in The India Cements Ltd.

Under the approved deal, UltraTech Cement will acquire a 32.72% stake in India Cements from its promoters and members of the promoter group, as well as from Sri Saradha Logistics Private Limited. UltraTech will make an open offer to acquire up to 26 percent more of the paid-up equity share capital of India Cements, taking its total potential shareholding to nearly 59%.

  • CCI approved UltraTech Cement’s acquisition of 32.72% stake in India Cements.
  • UltraTech will also make an open offer to acquire an additional 26% stake.
  • The transaction aims to provide UltraTech majority control over India Cements.
  • India Cements stock was trading at ₹365.00, up 7.62% from Friday's close.
“The Proposed Combination envisages UltraTech Cement Limited’s acquisition of 32.72% of the paid-up equity share capital of The India Cements Limited.”

This acquisition reflects UltraTech's strategic move to strengthen its position in the Indian cement market.
newTitle: India Cements soars 11% as UltraTech Cement’s stake buyout gets CCI nod

Siemens Limited shares faced a nearly 3% drop today, marking the fifth consecutive day of losses due to weak management commentary and lowered expectations for HVDC orders in India.

  • Shares opened lower, falling 2.8% to a low of ₹6,676.5 on the NSE.
  • Management lowered HVDC order expectations during an analyst call.
  • Concerns emerged over a slowdown in railway order flow and private capital expenditure.
  • Despite a strong performance in new-age tech sectors, traditional technology spending remains sluggish.
  • Company reported a 45.4% rise in net profit for Q4 2023 compared to the previous year.
“Though private capex remains steady in certain high-growth areas, it has been sluggish in traditional technologies.”

The recent market decline reflects broader concerns about Siemens’ performance and future order flows, especially in HVDC technology.

summary:

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Air India Express' debut flight from Surat to Bangkok experienced high demand for liquor, with claims from passengers that the stock had run out, though officials disputed this.

  • The inaugural flight lasted four hours and had 175 passengers aboard.
  • Officials stated that there was sufficient liquor and food on the flight contrary to social media claims.
  • Liquor use is banned in Gujarat; however, it was available on this private flight.
  • Passengers were served different types of liquors with varying prices during the flight.
The airline offers five types of liquor onboard. A 50 ml of Chivas Regal is priced at ₹ 600.

Overall, despite some complaints, the airline maintained they had enough stock to serve all passengers.

title: Bharat Global Developers shares, which rose 2,300% in the last 12 months, are now suspended for trading - CNBCTV18
summary:
Bharat Global Developers shares now suspended for trading

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024 9:09 AM IST | Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of Bharat Global Developers Ltd. have been suspended from trading following a dramatic rise in value over the past year, as ordered by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI).

  • Shares surged 105x from November 2023 to 2024.
  • SEBI's order cites concerns over suspicious financial disclosures made by the company.
  • The company previously reported negligible revenue, with a sudden spike in the latest financial quarter.
  • Management overhaul in December 2023 led to claims of significant business expansion.
  • Noticees restricted from accessing capital markets and required to submit asset inventories.
SEBI noted potential attempts to mislead investors through false disclosures and fabricated contracts.

The suspension highlights regulatory action against misleading financial practices in the market.
newTitle: Bharat Global Developers Shares Suspended After 2,300% Surge

title: Bharat Global Developers, set to issue eight bonus shares for every ten, split stock, suspended from trading - CNBCTV18
summary:
Bharat Global Developers' Shares Plummet: Trading Suspended After 2,300% Surge

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Bharat Global Developers Ltd. has had its shares suspended from trading as of December 2024, following a staggering 2,300% rise in the past year. This suspension comes amidst concerns regarding the validity of its financial disclosures.

  • SEBI, the market regulator, issued the suspension until further notice.
  • The company's promoters are banned from accessing capital markets.
  • Concerns arose from social media complaints about questionable financial practices.
  • The company's shares surged 105 times between November 2023 and November 2024.
  • SEBI noted manipulative practices associated with the financial reports of Bharat Global.
“The rise in shares was a result of wrong disclosures and misrepresented financials.”

This situation highlights the critical importance of transparency and integrity in financial disclosures within the capital market.
newTitle: Bharat Global Developers' Shares Plummet: Trading Suspended After 2,300% Surge

JSW Steel, Tata Steel, Jindal Steel and Power: Steel stocks likely to rise today; here is why - Upstox
summary:
Steel Stocks Rally as India Probes Increase in Steel Imports

Date: December 23, 2023

Source: PTI

Shares of leading steel manufacturers like JSW Steel, Tata Steel, and Jindal Steel saw gains of up to 2% following a government investigation into rising steel imports based on a complaint from the Indian Steel Association.

  • JSW Steel shares traded 2% higher at ₹935.45.
  • Tata Steel shares increased by 2% reaching ₹143.42.
  • SAIL stocks rose 1.5% to ₹117.94.
  • The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) initiated an investigation into 'Non-Alloy and Alloy Steel Flat Products'.
  • The investigation follows claims of significant injury to the domestic steel industry due to increased imports.
  • The Indian Steel Association has requested the imposition of a safeguard duty on these imports to protect local manufacturers.
The applicant has alleged that there is a 'recent, sudden, sharp, and significant' increase in the volume of imports, which has caused 'significant' injury to the domestic industry in India.

This investigation aims to provide a level playing field for domestic stakeholders amid rising import volumes and potential impacts on the local market.
newTitle: Steel Stocks Rally as India Probes Increase in Steel Imports

title: Elon Musk's X hikes Premium+ prices by 37.5% - TechCrunch
summary:
Elon Musk's X hikes Premium+ prices by 37.5%

Posted: 6:53 PM PST · December 22, 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

X is raising prices for its top-tier subscription service, Premium+, by 37.5% to $22 a month, marking the largest price increase since Elon Musk bought the platform in 2022.

  • The price hike will first affect U.S. users, effective December 21.
  • Annual subscriptions have increased from $168 to $229.
  • International markets will also see similar price increases.
  • In Nigeria, the price will rise to ₦34,000 monthly from ₦7,300.
  • In Turkey, the cost will go up from ₺300 to ₺770.
  • The basic subscription tier remains at $3 a month.
X said it was “adjusting” the prices to support the experience it offers.

The increase is significant, particularly for users in some markets, highlighting the platform's shifting pricing strategy.
newTitle: Elon Musk's X Increases Premium+ Subscription Prices by 37.5%

title: Who is Lauren Sanchez? Woman at the center of Jeff Bezos’ $600 million wedding rumor - The Times of India
Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: What causes it in your 40s? - The Indian Express
summary:
Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: What causes it in your 40s?

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The sudden passing of Rohan Mirchandani, CEO of Epigamia, has raised concerns about the rising incidence of sudden cardiac arrest among younger individuals, highlighting the need for early heart health checks in India.

  • Sudden cardiac arrest can affect anyone regardless of age, with individuals over 40 facing higher risks from coronary artery disease.
  • Heart attacks and sudden cardiac arrests are different; heart attacks involve blocked arteries, while cardiac arrests are typically related to electrical issues in the heart.
  • Younger individuals (under 35) may experience sudden cardiac arrest due to congenital defects or genetic abnormalities like Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy.
  • Recognizing the signs and symptoms is crucial, as there is a very limited window for effective treatment—primarily CPR and defibrillation.
  • Public awareness and training in CPR is significantly lower in India compared to countries like the US, where 85% of individuals are trained.
“We should make a serious attempt to keep our heart conditions in check early in life as we are genetically more prone to developing heart diseases.”

In conclusion, Rohan Mirchandani’s passing serves as a vital reminder about the importance of heart health checks and awareness around cardiac conditions, particularly in a country facing high rates of heart disease.
newTitle: Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani dies of sudden cardiac arrest: Understanding the Causes
